channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 越南国家主席邬文通的离任可能会对该国的经济前景产生影响，因为他在很大程度上扮演着礼仪性的角色。
item.description:
The departure of the Vietnamese president, Vo Van Thuong, who occupied a largely ceremonial role, could have implications for the country’s economic future https://t.co/omlFGTGVRn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 利奥-瓦拉德卡是谁？周三宣布下台的爱尔兰领导人的职业生涯。
item.description:
Who is Leo Varadkar? A look at the career of an Irish leader who announced on Wednesday that he was stepping down. https://t.co/98wQxscoS0

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英国数据隐私监管机构正在审查一份报告，该报告称有人试图获取威尔士王妃凯瑟琳住院期间的私人医疗记录。
item.description:
Britain’s data privacy watchdog is examining a report that an attempt was made to access the private medical records of Catherine, Princess of Wales, while she was in hospital. https://t.co/8wxgrqU18a

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 据越南国家媒体报道，越南总统邬文通因违反共产党条例而辞职。其明显不当行为的性质尚不清楚。
item.description:
President Vo Van Thuong of Vietnam has resigned after violating Communist Party regulations, state media reported. The nature of his apparent wrongdoing was unclear. https://t.co/mDvRzKbHLC

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：爱尔兰总理利奥-瓦拉德卡（Leo Varadkar）宣布他将辞去爱尔兰及其政党领导人的职务。
item.description:
Breaking News: Prime Minister Leo Varadkar of Ireland announced he would step down as the leader of the country and his party. https://t.co/iqGydC9T6q

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 长期以来，南苏丹一直受到气候变化加剧的灾害的影响，如反复发生的干旱和洪水。现在，酷热正迫使这个世界上最年轻的国家关闭学校。
item.description:
South Sudan has long been hit by climate change-exacerbated disasters like recurring droughts and floods. Now, extreme heat is forcing the world’s youngest nation to close its schools. https://t.co/6VQn6JEFln

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 尽管美国心存疑虑，但乌克兰人说，保卫战略价值不大的地方值得付出伤亡和武器代价，因为俄罗斯人付出的代价更大。
item.description:
Despite U.S. doubts, Ukrainians say that defending places with little strategic value is worth the cost in casualties and weapons, because Russians pay more. https://t.co/F2m2Z7Q8I5

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 青铜时代，英格兰东部曾有一个小型农耕社区，在一场大火夷为平地之前曾短暂繁荣。定居点的遗迹保存完好，让人们得以一窥 3000 年前英国的乡村生活。
item.description:
During the Bronze Age, a small farming community briefly flourished in eastern England before a fire tore through the compound. The remains of the settlement are superbly preserved, offering a glimpse of village life in Britain 3,000 years ago. https://t.co/yvHLLjVBu7

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 尽管韩日两国之间存在着长期的敌对关系，但韩国的棒球迷还是对来自日本的超级巨星大谷翔平（Shohei Ohtani）青睐有加。"一位资深的韩国体育记者说："如果你是棒球迷，你就会欣赏这样的人才。
item.description:
Baseball fans in South Korea have embraced Shohei Ohtani, the superstar from Japan, despite the longtime rivalry between the two countries. “If you’re a baseball fan, you appreciate that kind of talent,” one veteran South Korean sports journalist said. https://t.co/TFtcvx7azM

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 随着香港领导人接受中国自上而下的政治文化，许多人认为这座城市的活力和生机正在逐渐消失。
item.description:
As Hong Kong’s leaders embrace China’s top-down political culture, many believe the city’s dynamism and vitality are slipping away. https://t.co/QYqJwDloWt

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 20, 2024

item.title: 在同意讨论入侵拉法的替代方案一天后，本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理说没有替代方案。
item.description:
A day after agreeing to discuss alternatives to invading Rafah, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said there was no alternative. https://t.co/Pfcsaz9Jl8

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 马萨诸塞州一位退伍军人的家人发现了一批来自日本冲绳的藏品，包括绘画、陶器、卷轴和一幅复杂的手绘地图，并向联邦调查局报告了这一发现。这些文物已被归还。
item.description:
A veteran’s family in Massachusetts discovered a cache of items from Okinawa, Japan, including paintings and pottery, scrolls and an intricate hand-drawn map, and reported the discovery to the Federal Bureau of Investigation. The artifacts were returned. https://t.co/j0nteywKrT

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 盖蒂图片社警告说，威尔士王妃凯瑟琳拍摄的一张女王伊丽莎白二世的照片已被 "数字增强"，这增加了对王室与公众沟通的审查。
item.description:
Getty Images advirtió que una foto de la reina Isabel II tomada por Catalina, la princesa de Gales, había sido “optimizada digitalmente”, aumentando el escrutinio sobre la comunicación de la familia real con el público. https://t.co/0qK3DrUNDb

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 执政党的候选人是前总理阿马杜-巴。被许多人视为主要挑战者的巴希鲁-迪奥马耶-法耶刚刚出狱。另外还有 17 名候选人。
item.description:
The governing party’s candidate is Amadou Ba, a former prime minister. The man many see as the main challenger, Bassirou Diomaye Faye, was just released from jail. Then there are 17 other candidates. https://t.co/dbs91QdD9R

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 加拿大关于加沙冲突的争论蔓延到了该国的下议院，立法者们投票通过了反对党新民主党（New Democrats Party）提出的一揽子不具约束力的广泛措施，作为实现该地区和平的途径。
item.description:
The debate in Canada over the Gaza conflict spilled into the country’s House of Commons as lawmakers voted to endorse a wide-ranging package of nonbinding measures that the opposition New Democrats Party had presented as way to bring peace to the region. https://t.co/PhWCmmVYJc

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在发出这一警告的同时，以色列军队突袭了加沙的希法医院（Al-Shifa Hospital），他们说这次行动的目标是在医院内重新集结的哈马斯高级官员，并引发了长达数小时的战斗，造成了人员伤亡。
item.description:
The warning came as Israeli forces raided Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza, in an operation that they said had been aimed at senior Hamas officials who had regrouped on the premises, setting off an hourslong battle that resulted in casualties. https://t.co/g93HLQdnJn

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 对于加沙的许多平民来说，逃离以色列的袭击已经成为一种残酷的循环。
item.description:
For many civilians in Gaza, fleeing from Israeli attacks has become a grim cycle. https://t.co/vPkW5r0SJ3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 由于美国的额外援助仍有疑问，国防部长劳埃德-奥斯汀三世（Lloyd J. Austin III）呼吁以 "创造性、适应性和可持续的方式 "继续武装乌克兰，并赞扬了正在努力加强基辅军事力量的欧洲盟国。
item.description:
With additional American aid still in doubt, Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III called for “creative, adaptable and sustainable ways” to continue arming Ukraine and praised European allies who were trying to bolster Kyiv’s military. https://t.co/0VA8bESytR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 联合国召集的一个专家小组周一表示，加沙地带的饥荒 "迫在眉睫"，并警告说饿死人数将 "大幅增加"。
item.description:
A group of experts convened by the United Nations said Monday that famine was “imminent” in the Gaza Strip and warned of a “major acceleration” of starvation deaths. https://t.co/y99xOzLBbo

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 白宫预计将于下周初会见以色列代表团，讨论以色列入侵拉法的计划
item.description:
The White House is expected to meet with an Israeli delegation early next week to discuss Israel’s plans for an invasion of Rafah https://t.co/N7akvshFrN

item.title: 非洲哲学家保林-洪通吉（Paulin Hountondji）反对将非洲思维方式强行纳入欧洲世界观的做法。他的思想在非洲思想界产生了爆炸性影响。他已去世，享年 81 岁。
item.description:
The African philosopher Paulin Hountondji rebelled against efforts to force African ways of thinking into the European worldview. His thoughts had the effect of a bomb in African intellectual life. He has died at 81. https://t.co/0IM716lX5l

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 国务卿安东尼-布林肯警告中国，在南海对菲律宾船只发动 "武装 "袭击将触发华盛顿与马尼拉之间的共同自卫条约。
item.description:
Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned China that an “armed” attack against Philippine vessels in the South China Sea would trigger a mutual self-defense pact between Washington and Manila. https://t.co/u3Km7XZ2Wk

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 在住房危机、极右翼影响者以及有时错误信息的推动下，在爱尔兰小镇罗斯克里（Roscrea）发生的抗议活动象征着在爱尔兰各地被忽视的社区中，对移民的敌意正在激增。
item.description:
Fueled by a housing crisis, far-right influencers and at times, misinformation, a protest in the small Irish town of Roscrea symbolizes a surge in hostility toward migrants in neglected communities around the country. https://t.co/yIpySnNkw6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 以色列总理本雅明-内塔尼亚胡坚持认为，有必要派兵进入拉法，以消灭他所说的哈马斯在该市的部队。
item.description:
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel insisted that sending troops into Rafah was necessary to eliminate what he said were Hamas battalions in the city. https://t.co/DsccufBkmj

item.title: 联合国人权事务负责人沃尔克-蒂尔克（Volker Türk）周二将加沙正在发生的饥饿和饥荒这一完全可以避免的灾难归咎于以色列。
item.description:
The UN human rights chief, Volker Türk, blamed Israel on Tuesday for what he said was the entirely preventable catastrophe of starvation and famine unfolding in Gaza. https://t.co/A8qTKfVU0q

item.title: 巴西警方指控前总统博尔索纳罗在2022年大选失利后前往佛罗里达州之前，命令一名高级副手为自己和女儿获取伪造的Covid-19疫苗接种记录。
item.description:
Brazilian police have accused former President Jair Bolsonaro of ordering a top deputy to obtain falsified Covid-19 vaccination records for himself and his daughter, before he traveled to Florida following his election loss in 2022. https://t.co/S6HyYRZhyL

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024

item.title: 日本妇女劳动力参与率的提高提醒我们，不要认为就业市场的限制是明确和有限的。
item.description:
Japan’s improved labor force participation for women is a reminder not to assume that job market limits are clear and finite. https://t.co/vzBaS5vqXH

item.title: 即时新闻：巴西警方建议对前总统博尔索纳罗提出刑事指控，指控他伪造 Covid 疫苗接种记录。

item.title: 盖蒂图片公司（Getty Images）称，威尔士王妃凯瑟琳为英国女王伊丽莎白二世拍摄的一张照片被 "数字增强"，这使得王室与公众的沟通受到更严格的审查。
item.description:
Getty Images said a photo taken by Catherine, Princess of Wales, of Queen Elizabeth II had been “digitally enhanced,” adding to scrutiny over royal communications with the public. https://t.co/cGQFSxlxNM

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) March 19, 2024
